title: (x) video clips - digital sans {Yves, Adriano S}
author: gerolds

comments.content: Thirty years old? Yikes! It must have been freakishly wild back then, eh?
Nah. They just made a comeback. Also, back then it would have had only a hair's breadth of space between the characters.
Damn, it's hard to believe that this font is older than me. Wow.

Matthew, don't rub it in, whippersnapper!   
   
Wow a singing, drumming, type idenifying Waffle. Wait until I tell Ripley's about this.

By an amazing coincidence, I happened to run across a use of Digital Sans from the seventies this evening:   
   
 ![toronto](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123939im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/27762.jpg)   
   
This is taken from the February 1978 issue of _National Lampoon_ magazine. So, it really did exist back then, and notice how the spacing is just as said it would be.
